jnxVplsGenericDraft01MIB.name: jnxVplsGenericDraft01MIB

revisions.description: Removed inline definition of VPNIdOrZero in favor of importing the definition from VPN-TC-STD-MIB.
Changes from previous version: 1) Moved LDP Specific information to VPLS-LDP-DRAFT-01-MIB 2) Created the vplsStatusTable to store status information. 3)
Initial version published as part of RFC YYYY.

jnxVplsGenericDraft01MIB.organization: Layer 2 Virtual Private Networks (L2VPN) Working Group
jnxVplsGenericDraft01MIB.contactinfo: Thomas D. Nadeau Email: tnadeau@cisco.com The L2VPN Working Group (email distribution l2vpn@ietf.org, http://www.ietf.org/html.charters/l2vpn-charter.html)
jnxVplsGenericDraft01MIB.description: Copyright (C) The IETF Trust (2010). The initial version of this MIB module was published in RFC XXXX. -- RFC Editor: Please replace XXXX with RFC number & remove -- this note. For full legal notices see the RFC itself or see: http://www.ietf.org/copyrights/ianamib.html This MIB module contains generic managed object definitions for Virtual Private LAN Services as in [RFC4762] and [RFC4761] This MIB module enables the use of any underlying PseudoWire network.

PwIndexType.name: PwIndexType
PwIndexType.description: Pseudowire Index. A unique value, greater than zero, for each locally-defined PW for indexing several MIB tables associated with the particular PW. It is recommended that values are assigned contiguously starting from 1. The value for each PW MUST remain constant at least from one re-initialization to the next re-initialization.

JnxVplsBgpRouteDistinguisher.name: JnxVplsBgpRouteDistinguisher
JnxVplsBgpRouteDistinguisher.description: Syntax for a route distinguisher. For a complete definition of a route distinguisher, see [RFC4364]. For more details on use of a route distinguisher for a VPLS service, see [RFC4761]

JnxVplsBgpRouteTarget.name: JnxVplsBgpRouteTarget
JnxVplsBgpRouteTarget.description: Syntax for a route target. For a complete definition of a route target, see [RFC4364].

JnxVplsBgpRouteTargetType.name: JnxVplsBgpRouteTargetType
JnxVplsBgpRouteTargetType.description: Used to define the type of a route target usage. Route targets can be specified to be imported, exported, or both. For a complete definition of a route target, see [RFC4364].

jnxVplsConfigIndexNext.name: jnxVplsConfigIndexNext
jnxVplsConfigIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for jnxVplsConfigIndex when creating entries in the jnxVplsConfigTable. The value 0 indicates that no unassigned entries are available. To obtain the value of jnxVplsConfigIndex for a new entry in the jnxVplsConfigTable, the manager issues a management protocol retrieval operation to obtain the current value of jnxVplsConfigIndex. After each retrieval operation, the agent should modify the value to reflect the next unassigned index. After a manager retrieves a value the agent will determine through its local policy when this index value will be made available for reuse.

jnxVplsConfigTable.name: jnxVplsConfigTable
jnxVplsConfigTable.description: This table specifies information for configuring and monitoring Virtual Private Lan Services(VPLS).

jnxVplsConfigEntry.name: jnxVplsConfigEntry
jnxVplsConfigEntry.description: A row in this table represents a Virtual Private Lan Service(VPLS) in a packet network. It is indexed by jnxVplsConfigIndex, which uniquely identifies a single VPLS. A row is created by the operator or by the agent if a VPLS service is created by non-SNMP application or due to autodiscovery process. None of the read-create objects values can be changed when jnxVplsConfigRowStatus is in the active(1) state. Changes are allowed when the jnxVplsConfigRowStatus is in notInService(2) or notReady(3) states only. If the operator need to change one of the values for an active row the jnxVplsConfigRowStatus should be first changed to notInService(2), the objects may be changed now, and later to active(1) in order to re-initiate the signaling process with the new values in effect.

jnxVplsConfigIndex.name: jnxVplsConfigIndex
jnxVplsConfigIndex.description: Unique index for the conceptual row identifying a VPLS service.

jnxVplsConfigName.name: jnxVplsConfigName
jnxVplsConfigName.description: A textual name of the VPLS. If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not applicable, then this object MUST contain a zero-length octet string.

jnxVplsConfigDescr.name: jnxVplsConfigDescr
jnxVplsConfigDescr.description: A textual string containing information about the VPLS service. If there is no information for this VPLS service, then this object MUST contain a zero-length octet string.

jnxVplsConfigAdminStatus.name: jnxVplsConfigAdminStatus
jnxVplsConfigAdminStatus.description: The desired administrative state of the VPLS service. If the administrative status of the Vpls service is changed to enable then this service is able to utilize the pseudo wire to perform the tasks of a VPLS service. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

jnxVplsConfigMacLearning.name: jnxVplsConfigMacLearning
jnxVplsConfigMacLearning.description: This object specifies if MAC Learning is enabled in this service. If this object is true then Mac Learning is enabled. If false, then Mac Learning is disabled.

jnxVplsConfigDiscardUnknownDest.name: jnxVplsConfigDiscardUnknownDest
jnxVplsConfigDiscardUnknownDest.description: If the value of this object is 'true', then frames received with an unknown destination MAC are discarded in this VPLS. If 'false', then the packets are processed.

jnxVplsConfigMacAging.name: jnxVplsConfigMacAging
jnxVplsConfigMacAging.description: If the value of this object is 'true' then the MAC ageing process is enabled in this VPLS. If 'false', then the MAC ageing process is disabled

jnxVplsConfigFwdFullHighWatermark.name: jnxVplsConfigFwdFullHighWatermark
jnxVplsConfigFwdFullHighWatermark.description: This object specifies the utilization of the forwarding database for this VPLS instance at which the jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmRaised notification will be sent.

jnxVplsConfigFwdFullLowWatermark.name: jnxVplsConfigFwdFullLowWatermark
jnxVplsConfigFwdFullLowWatermark.description: This object specifies the utilization of the forwarding database for this VPLS instance at which the jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmCleared notification will be sent.

jnxVplsConfigRowStatus.name: jnxVplsConfigRowStatus
jnxVplsConfigRowStatus.description: For creating, modifying, and deleting this row. None of the read-create objects in the conceptual rows may be changed when this object is in the active(1) state.

jnxVplsConfigMtu.name: jnxVplsConfigMtu
jnxVplsConfigMtu.description: The value of this object specifies the MTU of this vpls instance.

jnxVplsConfigVpnId.name: jnxVplsConfigVpnId
jnxVplsConfigVpnId.description: This objects indicates the IEEE 802-1990 VPN ID of the associated VPLS service.

jnxVplsConfigServiceType.name: jnxVplsConfigServiceType
jnxVplsConfigServiceType.description: The value of this object specifies the type of service emulated by this vpls instance.

jnxVplsConfigStorageType.name: jnxVplsConfigStorageType
jnxVplsConfigStorageType.description: This variable indicates the storage type for this row.

jnxVplsStatusTable.name: jnxVplsStatusTable
jnxVplsStatusTable.description: This table provides information for monitoring Virtual Private Lan Services(VPLS).

jnxVplsStatusEntry.name: jnxVplsStatusEntry
jnxVplsStatusEntry.description: A row in this table represents a Virtual Private Lan Service(VPLS) in a packet network. It is indexed by jnxVplsConfigIndex, which uniquely identifies a single VPLS. A row in this table is automatically created by the agent when a VPLS service is configured.

jnxVplsStatusOperStatus.name: jnxVplsStatusOperStatus
jnxVplsStatusOperStatus.description: The current operational state of this VPLS Service.

jnxVplsStatusPeerCount.name: jnxVplsStatusPeerCount
jnxVplsStatusPeerCount.description: This objects specifies the number of peers present in this vpls instance.

jnxVplsPwBindTable.name: jnxVplsPwBindTable
jnxVplsPwBindTable.description: This table provides an association between a VPLS service and the corresponding Pseudo Wires. A service can have more than one Pseudo Wire association. Pseudo Wires are defined in the pwTable

jnxVplsPwBindEntry.name: jnxVplsPwBindEntry
jnxVplsPwBindEntry.description: Each row represents an association between a VPLS instance and one or more Pseudo Wires defined in the pwTable. Each index is unique in describing an entry in this table. However both indexes are required to define the one to many association of service to pseudowire.

jnxVplsPwBindConfigType.name: jnxVplsPwBindConfigType
jnxVplsPwBindConfigType.description: The value of this object indicates whether the Pseudo Wire binding was created manually or via autodiscovery. The value of this object must be specifed when the row is created and cannot be changed while the row status is active(1)

jnxVplsPwBindType.name: jnxVplsPwBindType
jnxVplsPwBindType.description: The value of this object indicates whether the Pseudo Wire binding is of type mesh or spoke. The value of this object must be specifed when the row is created and cannot be changed while the row status is active(1)

jnxVplsPwBindRowStatus.name: jnxVplsPwBindRowStatus
jnxVplsPwBindRowStatus.description: For creating, modifying, and deleting this row. None of the read-create objects in the conceptual rows may be changed when this object is in the active(1) state

jnxVplsPwBindStorageType.name: jnxVplsPwBindStorageType
jnxVplsPwBindStorageType.description: This variable indicates the storage type for this row.

jnxVplsPwBindIndex.name: jnxVplsPwBindIndex
jnxVplsPwBindIndex.description: Secondary Index for the conceptual row identifying a pseudowire within the PwEntry which MUST match an entry from the PW-STD-MIB's PwTable which represents an already-provisioned pseudowire that is then associated with this VPLS instance.

jnxVplsBgpADConfigTable.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigTable
jnxVplsBgpADConfigTable.description: This table specifies information for configuring BGP Auto-discovery parameters for a given Vpls service.

jnxVplsBgpADConfigEntry.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigEntry
jnxVplsBgpADConfigEntry.description: A row in this table represents BGP based autodiscovery is in use for this instance of Vpls. A row in this table is indexed by jnxVplsConfigIndex, which uniquely identifies a single VPLS. None of the read-create objects can be changed when jnxVplsBGPADConfigRowStatus is in active(1) state. Changes are allowed when the jnxVplsBGPADConfigRowStatus is in notInService(2) or notReady(3) states only. If the operator need to change one of the values for an active row the jnxVplsConfigRowStatus should be first changed to notInService(2), the objects may be changed now, and later to active(1) in order to re-initiate the signaling process with the new values in effect.

jnxVplsBgpADConfigRouteDistinguisher.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigRouteDistinguisher
jnxVplsBgpADConfigRouteDistinguisher.description: The route distinguisher for this VPLS. See [RFC4364] for a complete definition of a route distinguisher. for more details on use of a route distinguisher for a VPLS service, see [RFC4761]

jnxVplsBgpADConfigPrefix.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigPrefix
jnxVplsBgpADConfigPrefix.description: In case of auto-discovery the default prefix advertised is the ip address of the loopback. In case the user wants to override the loopback address, jnxVplsBgpADConfigPrefix should be set. When this value if non-zero it is used as the advertised IP address in the NLRI.

jnxVplsBgpADConfigVplsId.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigVplsId
jnxVplsBgpADConfigVplsId.description: VplsId is a unique identifier for all VSIs belonging to the same VPLS. It is advertised as an extended community

jnxVplsBgpADConfigRowStatus.name: jnxVplsBgpADConfigRowStatus
jnxVplsBgpADConfigRowStatus.description: For creating, modifying, and deleting this row. None of the read-create objects in the conceptual rows may be changed when this object is in the active(1) state.

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetTable.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetTable
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetTable.description: This table specifies the list of Route Targets imported or exported by BGP during auto-discovery of VPLS.

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetEntry.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetEntry
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetEntry.description: An entry in this table specifies the value of the Route Target being used by BGP. Depending on the value of jnxVplsBgpRteTargetType an RT might be exported or imported or both. Every VPLS which uses auto-discovery for finding peer nodes can import and export multiple Route Targets. This representation allows support for hierarchical VPLS.

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetIndex.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetIndex
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetIndex.description: This index along with jnxVplsConfigIndex,identifies one entry in the jnxVplsBgpRteTargetTable. By keeping jnxVplsConfigIndex constant and using new value of jnxVplsBgpRteTargetIndex user can configure multiple Route Targets for the same Vpls.

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTType.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTType
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTType.description: Used to define the type of a route target usage. Route targets can be specified to be imported, exported, or both. For a complete definition of a route target, see [RFC4364].

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRT.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRT
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRT.description: The route target associated with the VPLS service. For more details on use of route targets for a VPLS service, see [RFC4761]

jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTRowStatus.name: jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTRowStatus
jnxVplsBgpRteTargetRTRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. When a row in this table is in active(1) state, no objects in that row can be modified

jnxVplsStatusNotifEnable.name: jnxVplsStatusNotifEnable
jnxVplsStatusNotifEnable.reference: See also [RFC3413] for explanation that notifications are under the ultimate control of the MIB module in this document.
jnxVplsStatusNotifEnable.description: If this object is set to true(1), then it enables the emission of jnxVplsStatusChanged notification; otherwise this notification is not emitted.

jnxVplsNotificationMaxRate.name: jnxVplsNotificationMaxRate
jnxVplsNotificationMaxRate.description: This object indicates the maximum number of notifications issued per second. If events occur more rapidly, the implementation may simply fail to emit these notifications during that period, or may queue them until an appropriate time. A value of 0 means no throttling is applied and events may be notified at the rate at which they occur.

jnxVplsStatusChanged.name: jnxVplsStatusChanged
jnxVplsStatusChanged.description: The jnxVplsStatusChanged notification is generated when there is a change in the administrative or operating status of a VPLS service.

jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmRaised.name: jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmRaised
jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmRaised.description: The jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmRaised notification is generated when the utilization of the Forwarding database is above the value specified by jnxVplsConfigFwdFullHighWatermark.

jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmCleared.name: jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmCleared
jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmCleared.description: The jnxVplsFwdFullAlarmCleared notification is generated when the utilization of the Forwarding database is below the value specified by jnxVplsConfigFwdFullLowWatermark.
